value.name: Wish lists for Finance minister
value.description: Collection of tax arrearsRevise salary/pension once in 10 yrsWhile the Centre and most of the states are revising salaries and pension only once in ten years, Kerala is doing it once every five years.

provider.name: The New Indian Express on MSN.com

value.name: US Senate unveils text of border security, Ukraine aid bill
value.description: US senators on Sunday released the text of a much-anticipated deal that would unlock billions in new aid for Ukraine and Israel while tightening US border laws -- although its prospects for becoming law are unclear.

value.name: Renters Reform Bill - government reveals another Commons.delay
value.description: The Renters Reform Bill will not go for its Third Reading in the House of Commons for at least another fortnight.

value.name: Political uncertainty suggests ongoing landlord exodus, says Knight Frank
value.description: Prime London rental values fell closer to their longer-term average in January, as supply continued to increase.

value.name: Political parties must commit to apprenticeship levy reform, says BRC
value.description: The British Retail Consortium (BRC) warned that a reform of the apprenticeship levy is "vital" for the future growth of the economy and has called on the UK's political parties to commit to this in their manifestos ahead of the general election.

value.name: Marks & Spencer joins calls for apprenticeship levy reform
value.description: Marks & Spencer joins calls for apprenticeship levy reform, with high costs and lack of guidance cited by businesses as main barriers to taking on trainees

value.name: China can now monitor government-funded projects 24/7
value.description: Some Chinese developers must now install monitoring equipment at their projects, under official measures which took affect this month. The rules apply to firms that have received at least 30 million yuan ($4.2m; £3.3m) of government funding. It comes as authorities move to support China's crisis-hit property industry.

value.name: Bipartisan Senate group releases text of Ukraine-immigration agreement
value.description: The group—comprised of Republican Senator James Langford of Oklahoma, Independent Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona and Democratic Senator Chris Murphy of Connecticut—released the text of the legislation on Sunday night after months of back-and-forth. The bill’s total price tag is approximately $118bn

value.name: Nigel Farage ‘open-minded’ about joining Tories after next election
value.description: Former Ukip leader hints at move as he prepares to attend launch event for Liz Truss’s Popular Conservatives group next week

value.name: Fed-up Tory activists 'are on strike and turning to Reform UK' as 90% say Government is 'not Conservative enough'
value.description: Claire Bullivant (centre), editor of the Conservative Post news site, said widespread disaffection with the Government was making it hard to persuade activists to campaign for the party.

value.name: Tory members threaten to vote Reform unless one of these three people replaces Rishi Sunak
value.description: EXCLUSIVE: A major survey of registered Conservative members when Rishi Sunak became leader suggests party activists will go on strike at the general election.

value.name: Sadiq Khan warns 'I could lose' May mayoral election as he hints at 2036 Olympics bid for London
value.description: Green Zoe Garbett took 11% of the vote, while the Liberal Democrats’ Rob Blackie had 7. Reform UK’s Howard Cox was 4%, with 3% for other candidates. Sadiq Khan is the preferred candidate in both inner London and outer London - denting Hall's chances of ...

value.name: Reform of the Lords will go ahead undiluted, says Labour
value.description: Labour would not be drawn over which pledges would be in the manifesto but insisted it was not scaling back commitments

value.name: Will Liz Truss ever stop trying to be Margaret Thatcher?
value.description: The latest clique to raise its standard is the self-styled Popular Conservatives, which will be staging a big launch in Westminster this week. Its leader, counterintuitively, is Liz Truss, best known for her pioneering work in the field of very unpopular Conservatism indeed.

value.name: New Wales political system poses great danger - Wigley
